parts.text: {"word":"deific","priority":"★☆☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"adjective","definition":"神の、神性の、神のような","english_definition":"of or like God or a god; divine.","examples":[{"sentence":"The artist sought to capture the deific essence in his painting.","translation":"その芸術家は絵画の中に神のような本質を捉えようとした。"},{"sentence":"Some ancient rulers claimed deific status.","translation":"古代の支配者の中には、神のような地位を主張する者もいた。"},{"sentence":"The sunset was so beautiful it seemed almost deific.","translation":"夕焼けはとても美しく、まるで神々しいようだった。"}],"collocations":["deific power (神の力)","deific attributes (神の属性)","deific qualities (神のような性質)","deific being (神のような存在)","deific nature (神の性質)"],"synonyms":["divine","godlike","heavenly","sacred","holy","spiritual"],"antonyms":["human","mortal","earthly","profane","secular"]}],"etymology":{"value":"ラテン語の 'deus' (神) + '-fic' (作る) + '-ic' (形容詞語尾) に由来。文字通りには「神を作る」という意味だが、実際には「神の、神のような」という意味で使われる。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/diːˈɪfɪk/","syllables":"de-i-fic"},"inflection":{"notes":"形容詞なので、比較級・最上級の変化はありません。"},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Deific' は、非常にフォーマルで文学的な単語であり、日常会話ではほとんど使用されません。主に、神性、神の性質、または神のような特性を記述するために使用されます。'Divine' とほぼ同義ですが、'deific' はより強い意味合いを持ち、しばしば畏敬の念や崇拝の念を伴います。","priority":"★★☆"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ He had a deific experience at the concert.","correct":"✓ He had a divine experience at the concert.","note":"'Divine' は 'deific' よりも一般的で、より広い範囲の文脈で使用できます。"},{"incorrect":"✗ The deific power of nature is undeniable.","correct":"✓ The divine power of nature is undeniable.","note":"'Divine' は 'deific' よりも一般的で、より自然な響きになります。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["deify (動詞: 神格化する、神として崇拝する)","deification (名詞: 神格化、神聖視)"],"phrases":["deific vision (神の啓示)"],"priority":"★☆☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"C2","frequency_google_ngram":"非常に低頻度 (Very low frequency) - 文学や宗教的な文脈でまれに使用される程度。","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C2","text":"'Deific' is a formal and somewhat rare adjective used to describe something that is of or like God or a god. It implies a divine or godlike quality. This word is not commonly used in everyday conversation and is more likely to be found in literature, religious texts, or philosophical discussions. It is often used to describe abstract concepts or qualities that are associated with the divine.","example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The ancient Egyptians worshipped the pharaoh as a deific ruler.","translation":"古代エジプト人はファラオを神のような支配者として崇拝した。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"神のような"},{"sentence":"The artist's depiction of the angel was imbued with a deific glow.","translation":"その芸術家による天使の描写は、神々しい輝きに満ちていた。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"神の"},{"sentence":"Philosophers have long debated the deific nature of the universe.","translation":"哲学者たちは、宇宙の神聖な性質について長い間議論してきた。","type":"adjective","meaning_category":"神性の"}]}
